intro: Merremia hirta var. retusa, commonly known as the hairy morning glory, is a climbing vine native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and forests. Due to its rapid growth and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated as a garden plant.
